definition: (used of a device) designed so that a property (as e.g. light) can be varied, a quantity that can assume any of a set of values
details:
adjective
- (used of a device) designed so that a property (as e.g. light) can be varied
= example: (used of a device) designed so that a property (as e.g. light) can be varied
- liable to or capable of change
= example: liable to or capable of change
- marked by diversity or difference
= synonyms: varying
noun
- a quantity that can assume any of a set of values
- a symbol (like x or y) that is used in mathematical or logical expressions to represent a variable quantity
- something that is likely to vary
- a star that varies noticeably in brightness
